elements.content: Adsorption properties and structure of CO2 adsorbed on open coordination sites of metal–organic framework Ni2(dhtp) from gas adsorption, IR spectroscopy and X-ray diffraction†AdsorptionadsorptionIR spectroscopy Pascal D. C. Dietzel Rune E. Johnsen Helmer Fjellvåg Silvia Bordiga Elena Groppo Sachin Chavan and Richard Blom adsorptionfuelsolventssolvent1adsorptionadsorptionnitrogen2adsorption3adsorption45adsorptionadsorption6polymeradsorptionXRD7X-ray diffraction dataIR spectroscopyAdsorptionadsorption7nitrogenadsorptionadsorptionadsorptionadsorption8cation9adsorptionAdsorption isotherms (left) and differential adsorption enthalpies (right) for the adsorption of CO2 on CPO-27-Ni at the temperatures indicated.AdsorptionadsorptionX-ray diffractometer7,10,1112ligandssolventsolvent7,10,1314Crystal structure of CPO-27-Ni with adsorbed CO2 at the metal atom. (a) Packing along [001] showing the end-on coordination of the CO2 molecule; (b) local environment of the adsorbed CO2 molecule. The black dashed lines indicate selected distances longer than covalent bonds and shorter than 3.2 Å (corresponding to the sum of the van der Waals radii of oxygen and carbon) which might influence the structure of the CO2 molecule through crystal packing effects or back-donation.

Crystal structure of CPO-27-Ni with adsorbed CO2 at the metal atom. (a) Packing along [001] showing the end-on coordination of the CO2 molecule; (b) local environment of the adsorbed CO2 molecule. The black dashed lines indicate selected distances longer than covalent bonds and shorter than 3.2 Å (corresponding to the sum of the van der Waals radii of oxygen and carbon) which might influence the structure of the CO2 molecule through crystal packing effects or back-donation.

elements.content: Fig. 2 Crystal structure of CPO-27-Ni with adsorbed CO2 at the metal atom. (a) Packing along [001] showing the end-on coordination of the CO2 molecule; (b) local environment of the adsorbed CO2 molecule. The black dashed lines indicate selected distances longer than covalent bonds and shorter than 3.2 Å (corresponding to the sum of the van der Waals radii of oxygen and carbon) which might influence the structure of the CO2 molecule through crystal packing effects or back-donation.

† Electronic supplementary information (ESI) available: Details of the structure refinement. CCDC reference number 692602. For ESI and crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format see DOI: 10.1039/b810574j

elements.content: crystallographic data‡ The powder sample of the CPO-27-Ni/CO2 was measured at the Swiss-Norwegian Beamlines (BM01B) at the European Synchrotron Radiation Facility (ESRF) in Grenoble, France. Rietveld refinement was performed with the WINPOW program. Details of the refinement process are given in the ESI.† C4H1NiO3·(CO2)0.67, M = 185.4 g mol−1, trigonal space groupR, a = b = 25.7836(11) Å, c = 6.7474(3) Å, α = β = 90°, γ = 120°, V = 3884.7(5) Å3, Z = 18, λ = 0.520054 Å, T = 100 K, 2θ range 1.027–25.499°, step size 0.004°, Rp = 0.0590, Rwp = 0.0814, Rexp = 0.0264, RBragg = 0.0155, GoF = 3.09.
elements.clean_text:
crystallographic data

‡ The powder sample of the CPO-27-Ni/CO2 was measured at the Swiss-Norwegian Beamlines (BM01B) at the European Synchrotron Radiation Facility (ESRF) in Grenoble, France. Rietveld refinement was performed with the WINPOW program. Details of the refinement process are given in the ESI.† C4H1NiO3⋅(CO2)0.67, M = 185.4 g mol-1, trigonal space groupR, a = b = 25.7836(11) Å, c = 6.7474(3) Å, α = β = 90°, γ = 120°, V = 3884.7(5) Å3, Z = 18, λ = 0.520054 Å, T = 100 K, 2θ range 1.027-25.499°, step size 0.004°, Rp = 0.0590, Rwp = 0.0814, Rexp = 0.0264, RBragg = 0.0155, GoF = 3.09.
